channel.title: Zero Plus One Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Hayden Wade
channel.description: We strive to bring you the most valuable insights into becoming and being a successful software engineer. Our host Hayden Wade has coded until his fingers were sore but most of all he enjoys mentoring aspiring engineers, speaking at Universities, and petting alpacas in his spare time. In these episodes of the Zero Plus One Podcast we will cover everything from how to land your dream job, career advice, tech, and hear extraordinary guests talk about their journey to success.
channel.itunes:keywords: career advice, software engineer, computer science, dream job, successful software engineer, career tips, software engineering

item.itunes:title: All Things Job Searching And Job Market With Zac Kallas
item.title: All Things Job Searching And Job Market With Zac Kallas
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I interview Zac Kallas of SkyWater Search Partners to talk about all things recruiting and job searching. Zac and I dive into the current state of the job market, and challenges for both software engineers and recruiters. We discuss how recruiters can best serve software engineers in their job search and what value they bring to the table. Thanks for listening and don't forget to like and subscribe!00:00 - Introduction02:10 - Why would a software engineer want to work with a r...
item.description:
In this episode I interview Zac Kallas of SkyWater Search Partners to talk about all things recruiting and job searching. Zac and I dive into the current state of the job market, and challenges for both software engineers and recruiters. We discuss how recruiters can best serve software engineers in their job search and what value they bring to the table. Thanks for listening and don't forget to like and subscribe!

00:00 - Introduction
02:10 - Why would a software engineer want to work with a recruiter?
07:00 - Types of candidates that succeed
10:40 - How to attract good talent
15:30 - Current Job Market
17:50 - Trends
31:50 - Tips for Recruiters
33:55 - Salary Ranges
42:45 - Unlimited PTO
48:13 - How can recruiters be a better partner to software engineers (understanding your value)
58:50 - Outro

Zac Kallas
https://www.linkedin.com/in/zac-kallas
www.skywatersearch.com
@skywater

item.itunes:title: Japan English Teacher Turns Software Engineer with Wyatt Weisensel
item.title: Japan English Teacher Turns Software Engineer with Wyatt Weisensel
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I interview Wyatt Weisensel on how he went from being an english teacher in Japan to becoming a software engineer. Wyatt goes in-depth about what his 5 months of unemployment and job searching looked like during covid. He talks about how to stay relevant, the importance of side projects, how to take control of the interview, understanding your value, and the importance of mentorship. We go on to talk about how interviewing in the midwest is different and the same from big tech...
item.description:
In this episode I interview Wyatt Weisensel on how he went from being an english teacher in Japan to becoming a software engineer. Wyatt goes in-depth about what his 5 months of unemployment and job searching looked like during covid. He talks about how to stay relevant, the importance of side projects, how to take control of the interview, understanding your value, and the importance of mentorship. We go on to talk about how interviewing in the midwest is different and the same from big tech companies, FANG.  Making a decision or evaluating offers can be difficult, so Wyatt and I talk about why it's important to look at more than just salary when choosing  an offer.

Wyatt Weisensel
https://www.linkedin.com/in/wyattw/
https://wordcompleteonline.com/

item.itunes:title: The Power of Being Surrounded By Like Minded Individuals With Neil CarlinSchauer
item.title: The Power of Being Surrounded By Like Minded Individuals With Neil CarlinSchauer
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, I interview Neil CarlinSchauer, a software engineer. He talks about how he went from being a super senior failing classes to becoming a full stack software engineer who is now leading projects and mentoring junior engineers. Seeking and creating opportunities was a recurring theme in Neil’s career. Neil goes in depth on how he “leveled up” during college with his first internship and by surrounding himself with like minded individuals. To wrap up the interview I asked him wha...
item.description:
In this episode, I interview Neil CarlinSchauer, a software engineer. He talks about how he went from being a super senior failing classes to becoming a full stack software engineer who is now leading projects and mentoring junior engineers. Seeking and creating opportunities was a recurring theme in Neil’s career. Neil goes in depth on how he “leveled up” during college with his first internship and by surrounding himself with like minded individuals. To wrap up the interview I asked him what are four tips for software engineering candidates, he replied with five:

  1. Research the company you’re applying for
  2. Be up to date on your technical skills (fundamentals)
  3. Practice interviewing
  4. Solid communication
  5. Don’t be a dick


Be sure to checkout Neil CarlinSchauer on social:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/neilcarlinschauer/

Pramp - referral link we both get free peer to peer interviewing credits
https://www.pramp.com/invt/lYxw4xqvojcmWYrVQ0mA

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, I interview Neil CarlinSchauer, a software engineer. He talks about how he went from being a super senior failing classes to becoming a full stack software engineer who is now leading projects and mentoring junior engineers. Seeking and creating opportunities was a recurring theme in Neil’s career. Neil goes in depth on how he “leveled up” during college with his first internship and by surrounding himself with like minded individuals. To wrap up the interview I asked him what are four tips for software engineering candidates, he replied with five:

  1. Research the company you’re applying for
  2. Be up to date on your technical skills (fundamentals)
  3. Practice interviewing
  4. Solid communication
  5. Don’t be a dick

item.itunes:title: It's a Great Time To Be or Become a Software Engineer
item.title: It's a Great Time To Be or Become a Software Engineer
item.itunes:summary: During these hard times and this state of social distancing, I wanted to bring a different perspective to this episode. I give three tips on being an effective teammate while working from home, as well as, a deep dive into a few topics from last episode: getting an internship, resume advice, study plans, and recovering from failure. I give additional advice on how to network while you are stuck inside.Stay healthy and safe! Help stop the coronavirus (covid 19) by social distancing!Social Medi...
item.description:
During these hard times and this state of social distancing, I wanted to bring a different perspective to this episode. I give three tips on being an effective teammate while working from home, as well as, a deep dive into a few topics from last episode: getting an internship, resume advice, study plans, and recovering from failure. I give additional advice on how to network while you are stuck inside.

Stay healthy and safe!
Help stop the coronavirus (covid 19) by social distancing!

Social Media:

item.itunes:title: The Hustle With Anas Abdulahi
item.title: The Hustle With Anas Abdulahi
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, I interview Anas Abdulahi, an aspiring software engineer. He tells us about how he got his first internship and first full time job after attending college. He shares his failures and how he overcame those failures in order to get to where he is today. We cover the differences between interviewing for a internship verses a full-time position, how to study for technical interviews, and understanding your value when you receive an offer.Be sure to check out Anas on social media...
item.description:
In this episode, I interview Anas Abdulahi, an aspiring software engineer. He tells us about how he got his first internship and first full time job after attending college. He shares his failures and how he overcame those failures in order to get to where he is today. We cover the differences between interviewing for a internship verses a full-time position, how to study for technical interviews, and understanding your value when you receive an offer.


Be sure to check out Anas on social media:

item.itunes:title: The Beginning - An Intro to the Zero Plus One Podcast
item.title: The Beginning - An Intro to the Zero Plus One Podcast
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to the Zero Plus One Podcast!!! I am excited to bring you the knowledge and motivation to becoming a successful software engineer. This podcast will cover the tactical steps needed to land your dream job. I'll be covering everything needed to get you your first software engineering job or internship, such as interviewing tips and tricks, resume advice, studying for technical interviews, and negotiating offers. For those who have already landed their first software engineering job, I'l...
item.description:
Welcome to the Zero Plus One Podcast!!! I am excited to bring you the knowledge and motivation to becoming a successful software engineer. This podcast will cover the tactical steps needed to land your dream job. I'll be covering everything needed to get you your first software engineering job or internship, such as interviewing tips and tricks, resume advice, studying for technical interviews, and negotiating offers.

For those who have already landed their first software engineering job, I'll be covering how to grow and advance in your career, how to become a leader on your team and within an organization, and how to navigate the journey of a software engineer.

You will hear from special guests from a variety of roles to give you better insight and a different perspective into what it's like to be a software engineer. A few examples include: having a hiring manager on to talk about what she or he looks for in an ideal candidate, having a recruiter on to talk about how they can serve you best as a software engineer searching for a new job, or having a software engineer on to talk about their experience as a software engineer.


Social Media:
zeroplusonepodcast.com
instagram.com/zeroplusonepodcast
linkedin.com/company/zeroplusonepodcast
twitter.com/zeroplusonepod
facebook.com/zeroplusonepodcast
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to the Zero Plus One Podcast!!! I am excited to bring you the knowledge and motivation to becoming a successful software engineer. This podcast will cover the tactical steps needed to land your dream job. I'll be covering everything needed to get you your first software engineering job or internship, such as interviewing tips and tricks, resume advice, studying for technical interviews, and negotiating offers.

For those who have already landed their first software engineering job, I'll be covering how to grow and advance in your career, how to become a leader on your team and within an organization, and how to navigate the journey of a software engineer.

You will hear from special guests from a variety of roles to give you better insight and a different perspective into what it's like to be a software engineer. A few examples include: having a hiring manager on to talk about what she or he looks for in an ideal candidate, having a recruiter on to talk about how they can serve you best as a software engineer searching for a new job, or having a software engineer on to talk about their experience as a software engineer.
